sections.text: MIT Sloan’s STEM‑designated MFin provides a deep foundation in modern finance, data analytics, and financial engineering to prepare students for global finance careers.

items: 15.454 Financial Mathematics or 15.455 Advanced Financial Mathematics
Electives in Asset Management, FinTech, and Risk
sections.text: The curriculum blends core finance theory with quantitative methods and advanced electives, allowing customization across asset management, quantitative finance, and corporate finance.
Applicants should bring strong quantitative preparation; students must pass a Python programming literacy requirement.
Graduates enter roles in investment management, quantitative research, trading, corporate finance, and risk analytics.
